result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dathan Emmanuel Bean Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dathan Emmanuel Bean Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg appeared by video for Dathan Emmanuel Bean Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 11-21-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dathan Emmanuel Bean Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court for Dathan Emmanuel Bean Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant just received an offer and requesting a status date.  Case is adjourned to 10-10-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Dathan E. Bean, Jr. - #2022007953, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Dathan Emmanuel Bean not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense bail motion held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense's bail motion.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dathan Emmanuel Bean in court with Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg; both appear by video.  Defendant Dathan Emmanuel Bean in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Blak Laufenberg. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail, filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 072350,
Payable Number: 1023108,
Receipt Number: 22RP030698,
Amount: $20.00
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Dathan Emmanuel Bean not in court, defendant in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court or in the alternative status. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Damarion L. B.; Kehlani L. B.; Lamani A. H.; Lanyah N. H.; Riley S. L. Jr.; Catera F. S.; Erica L. S.; Jean D. S.; Miliahn T. W.; 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dathan Emmanuel Bean in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Dathan Emmanuel Bean in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dathan Emmanuel Bean appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
